repnme.cdata!: Republic of Yemen - Emergency Recovery Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Emergency Recovery Project (ERP) in
            Yemen. The objectives of the project were to: (a) provide
            additional education facilities through the construction of
            420 classrooms, provision of school equipment and materials,
            and training of teachers; (b) support agricultural
            production with seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, feedstuffs,
            veterinary products, equipment, spare parts, and flood
            control materials (gabions); (c) procure equipment,
            materials and training for labor intensive construction of
            410 km secondary and feeder roads; and (d) prepare 2,500
            serviced sites for housing construction by returnees.
            Bank's performance was not satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was not satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (1) there should be
            specific plan of coordination between Project Management
            Unit (PMU) and Project Implementation Units (PIU) especially
            in a multi sector project like ERP; (ii) to award the PIU’s
            the complete facilities as an independent unit, to enable
            the proper execution of its tasks rather than attaching the
            PIU's under direct dealings with the Ministers as it
            happened in ERP; (iii) provision of adequate counterpart
            budget without any delay for smooth execution of the
            projects activities (iv) pre co-ordination with water,
            Drainage services sector before the commencement of any
            housing complex, to facilitate its proper execution; (v)
            good project preparation and strong support from the
            concerned authorities in the government; and (vi) continuous
            monitoring to ensure proper execution of project.

18156185.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

repnme.cdata!: Republic of Yemen - Emergency Recovery Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Recovery
            Project is to support a set of core components from the
            emergency recovery program (ERP) that will help meet
            immediate returnee-induced needs for essential social
            services, maintain basic nutritional levels, and expand
            housing facilities and social infrastructure. The project
            consists of the following components:  (a) expanding social
            infrastructure through procurement of key equipment,
            materials, and training for (i) the labor intensive
            construction and maintenance of 410 km of priority and
            economically viable secondary and feeder roads related to
            centers of concentration of returnees; and (ii) the
            provision of 2,500 serviced sites for housing construction
            by returnees; (b) strengthening essential social services
            through expansion of existing education facilities,
            equipment, materials and teacher training to meet increased
            demands from returnees; (c) supporting agricultural
            activities through provision of gabion baskets, supplies of
            seeds, chemicals, fertilizers, spare parts for farm
            machinery, feedstuff, and veterinary products to help
            maintain crop and livestock production; and (d)
            strengthening program management through equipment,
            vehicles, training and operating expenses and technical
            assistance for planning and procurement.
